content.raw:
1. is as you say messy as hell. 2 doesn't work for 'drive by' contributors who are not regular so can't be a general solution. 3. is annoying and seems vulnerable to us closing a branch too soon only to realise we need to put more commits in, although so far this is my favourite option. 4. Makes the tree of commits in tortoise hg have a huge number of extra lines on it bringing the branches forward to the point where they are closed.

I wonder what the 'squash' commit option in the menu that the merger sees does?

There is also 5. the merger pulls the branch in question from the author of the pull request, merges locally and then pushes the result to the main repo (this marks the pull request as merged). But that's pretty silly too, and the whole thing seems like a bit of a deficiency in bitbucket.
